meanings.definition: Causing or likely to cause horror; shocking.
meanings.sent1: The haunted house was horrible, with creaky floors and ghostly sounds.
meanings.sent2: The horror movie was so horrible that I couldn't sleep that night.
meanings.sent3: The horrible clown made everyone scream in fear at the circus.
meanings.sent4: The horrible storm raged outside, with thunder shaking the windows.
meanings.sent5: The horrible news of the accident spread quickly through the small town.

meanings.sent1: The spoiled milk had a horrible smell that made me gag.
meanings.sent2: The traffic jam on the highway was horrible, causing long delays.
meanings.sent3: The horrible taste of the medicine made the child refuse to take it.
meanings.sent4: The horrible day ended with a flat tire on the way home.
meanings.sent5: The horrible cafeteria food made the students lose their appetite.

meanings.sent1: The horrible weather ruined our plans for a picnic in the park.
meanings.sent2: The horrible smell coming from the garbage bin made us hold our noses.
meanings.sent3: The horrible music blaring from the neighbor's house kept us up all night.
meanings.sent4: The horrible mistake cost the company a lot of money.
meanings.sent5: The horrible sunburn left her skin red and painful.
